text: Explore Microbiome Profiling QIIME2 Pipeline Chapter 6 IMAP Practical User Guides series.Building groundwork laid previous chapters, section focuses standardized approaches metadata sequence data retrieval, quality control, microbiome profiling using Mothur pipeline.Now, seamlessly integrating QIIME2 workflow Part 06, provide comprehensive perspective application realm microbiome research.Join us navigate features QIIME2, leveraging insights gained prior analyses. chapter facilitates smooth transition, empowering skills necessary conduct robust microbiome bioinformatics derive meaningful conclusions data.

heading: 1 Microbiome Bioinformatics with QIIME2

heading: 2.1.2 Create qiime2 env and install qiime2
text: Current YAML file: qiime2-2023.2-py38-osx-conda.yml availableThe qiime2 YAML file contains 500 dependencies. Listed just QIIME 2 framework dependencies get installation started.
code:
name: qiime2202320
channels:
    - qiime2/label/r2023.2
    - conda-forge
    - bioconda
    - defaults
dependencies:
    - q2cli=2023.2.0
    - qiime2=2023.2.0
    - python=3.8.16
    - q2-alignment=2023.2.0
    - q2-composition=2023.2.0
    - q2-cutadapt=2023.2.0
    - q2-dada2=2023.2.0
    - q2-deblur=2023.2.0
    - q2-demux=2023.2.0
    - q2-diversity=2023.2.0
    - q2-diversity-lib=2023.2.0
    - q2-emperor=2023.2.0
    - q2-feature-classifier=2023.2.0
    - q2-feature-table=2023.2.0
    - q2-fragment-insertion=2023.2.0
    - q2-gneiss=2023.2.0
    - q2-longitudinal=2023.2.0
    - q2-metadata=2023.2.0
    - q2-mystery-stew=2023.2.0
    - q2-phylogeny=2023.2.0
    - q2-quality-control=2023.2.0
    - q2-quality-filter=2023.2.0
    - q2-sample-classifier=2023.2.0
    - q2-taxa=2023.2.0
    - q2-types=2023.2.0
    - q2-vsearch=2023.2.0

heading: 2.1.3 Installing QIIME2 using a bash script
code:
conda activate base
wget https://data.qiime2.org/distro/core/qiime2-2023.2-py38-osx-conda.yml
conda env create -n qiime2-2023.2 --file qiime2-2023.2-py38-osx-conda.yml
conda activate qiime2-2023.2 
qiime info

heading: 3 Import or Download Demo Data
text: Demo data one QIIME2[1] tutorials.
code:
mkdir -p resources
mkdir -p resources/reads
mkdir -p resources/references

cd mkdir -p resources/reads

wget \
  -O "sample-metadata.tsv" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2023.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/sample_metadata.tsv"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/forward.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2023.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/forward.fastq.gz"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/reverse.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2023.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/reverse.fastq.gz"

wget \
  -O "emp-paired-end-sequences/barcodes.fastq.gz" \
  "https://data.qiime2.org/2023.2/tutorials/atacama-soils/10p/barcodes.fastq.gz"

heading: 6.1 Alignment of representative sequences
text: MAFFT (Multiple Alignment using Fast Fourier Transform) software provides alignments representative sequences.run alignment mask function remove poor alignments.

heading: 6.2 Quality control and feature table with DADA2
text: QIIME2 uses DADA2[2] tool :Detecting poor reads Illumina amplicon sequence data.Denoising.Filtering chimeric sequences.Filtering phiX reads present marker gene.Construction feature table.

heading: 6.3 Using custom SILVA classifier
text: Silva resourcesTaxonomy filesBelow simple outline steps involved constructing QIIME 2 compatible reference SILVA.Begin downloading relevant taxonomy sequence files SILVA.Import files QIIME 2.Prepare fixed-rank taxonomy file.Remove sequences excessive degenerate bases homopolymers.Remove sequences may short /long. option condition length filtering based taxonomy.Dereplicate sequences taxonomy.Build classifier.

heading: 7 QIIME2 Diversity Analysis
text: described

heading: 7.1 Alpha diversity metrics
text: Shannon’s diversity index (quantitative measure community richness)-Observed OTUs (qualitative measure community richness)Faith’s Phylogenetic Diversity (qualitiative measure community richness incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)Evenness (Pielou’s Evenness; measure community evenness)

heading: 7.2 Beta diversity metrics
text: Jaccard distance (qualitative measure community dissimilarity)Bray-Curtis distance (quantitative measure community dissimilarity)unweighted UniFrac distance (qualitative measure community dissimilarity incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)weighted UniFrac distance (quantitative measure community dissimilarity incorporates phylogenetic relationships features)

heading: 7.3 Expected output artifacts
text: Saved FeatureTable[Frequency] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/rarefied_table.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/faith_pd_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/observed_features_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/shannon_vector.qzaSaved SampleData[AlphaDiversity] : qiime2_process/core-metrics/evenness_vector.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/unweighted_unifrac_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/weighted_unifrac_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/jaccard_distance_matrix.qzaSaved DistanceMatrix : qiime2_process/core-metrics/bray_curtis_distance_matrix.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/unweighted_unifrac_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/weighted_unifrac_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/jaccard_pcoa_results.qzaSaved PCoAResults : qiime2_process/core-metrics/bray_curtis_pcoa_results.qza

heading: 7.4 Expected output visualizations
text: Saved Visualization : qiime2_process/core-metrics/unweighted_unifrac_emperor.qzvSaved Visualization : qiime2_process/core-metrics/weighted_unifrac_emperor.qzvSaved Visualization : qiime2_process/core-metrics/jaccard_emperor.qzvSaved Visualization : qiime2_process/core-metrics/bray_curtis_emperor.qzv

heading: 8 Differential Abundance
text: QIIME2 uses ANCOM (Analysis Composition) identify differentially abundant taxa.

heading: C Session Information
text: Reproducibility relies ability precisely recreate working environment, session information serves vital reference achieve consistency. record details R environment, package versions, system settings computing environment time analysis.detailed overview tools versions suitable guide, encourage explore session information saved accompanying text file named resources/session_info.txt,
code:
library(knitr)
library(sessioninfo)

# Get session info
info <- capture.output(print(session_info()))

# Create the 'resources' folder if it doesn't exist
if (!dir.exists("resources")) {
  dir.create("resources")
}

# Save the session information to a text file without line numbers
cat(info, file = "resources/session_info.txt", sep = "\n")
